title: U.S. and Europe Crack Down on REvil Ransomware Group
sub_head: The Justice Department said it had clawed back $6.1 million in ransomware payments and seeks extradition of Ukrainian arrested in Poland
body:
Law enforcement in the U.S. and Europe announced a series of actions aimed at a Russia-linked criminal group behind ransomware attacks that crippled critical infrastructure and businesses, aiming to strike a blow at a scourge the Biden administration has identified as a prime national-security threat.
In Washington, the Justice Department announced the recent arrest in Poland of a Ukrainian national behind the REvil ransomware attack on Kaseya Ltd., a technology provider, and the indictment of another individual.
